decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to rapidly generate mana through rituals and fast mana sources in order to cast the Goblin Charbelcher and activate its ability, dealing lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes Burning Wish to search for additional win conditions or answers to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently through explosive plays, with a minimal amount of interaction with the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced, aggressive strategy with a mix of disruption and threats in the form of powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tombstalker. By utilizing efficient spells like Daze, Abrupt Decay, and Hymn to Tourach, along with strong card selection from Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and quickly close out the match. With a solid mana base and access to key cards like Force of Will and Deathrite Shaman, this deck is designed to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's plans while maintaining a steady stream of threats.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's resources while quickly establishing a strong board presence. By utilizing cards like Hymn to Tourach and Wasteland to disrupt their hand and mana base, combined with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out the game quickly. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and efficient threats, it aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a fast-paced, tempo-driven game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells like Force of Will and Hymn to Tourach to control the opponent's hand while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Deathrite Shaman. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Daze, while also presenting threats that are difficult to deal with, such as True-Name Nemesis and Delver of Secrets. The combination of disruption and aggression allows the deck to control the game tempo and force the opponent to play on the back foot.

The deck is focused on being aggressive and disruptive while maintaining a strong board presence. It includes efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis, backed up by powerful disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Abrupt Decay. The deck also includes key card selection and card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base is designed to support a consistent and smooth mana curve, with a focus on utilizing dual lands and fetch lands to have access to all necessary colors of mana.

The deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan while also applying pressure with efficient creatures. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck also has card advantage through Brainstorm and Ancestral Vision. Aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent help to close out the game quickly. The mana base includes a variety of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistency in casting spells of all colors.

The deck focuses on aggressively controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan with efficient spells like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Abrupt Decay. It also aims to apply pressure and close out the game quickly with creatures such as Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck utilizes a mix of disruption, card advantage, and efficient threats to assert dominance and outmaneuver the opponent in a fast-paced tempo strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressive play using low-cost creatures and disruption spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. By efficiently managing resources and using cards like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis alongside counterspells and removal, the deck aims to quickly apply pressure and close out games before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is designed to support a quick and consistent game plan, while cards like Wasteland and Stifle provide additional disruption to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain tempo.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with various taxing effects like Thalia, Spirit of the Labyrinth, and Phyrexian Revoker, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Mirran Crusader. The deck aims to control the opponent's resources with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while protecting its own creatures with Mother of Runes and equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull. The deck also has some utility cards like Flickerwisp and Aven Mindcensor to further disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this Aggro - Death & Taxes Legacy deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by taxing their resources with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Serra Avenger. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Flickerwisp and Mother of Runes, while also providing card advantage and options for removal with equipment such as Sword of Fire and Ice. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy and provide utility lands to improve the deck's overall game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements like hand disruption, removal spells, and planeswalkers to dominate the game. It also utilizes the Stoneforge Mystic package to search and equip powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. The deck is designed to grind out opponents by maintaining board control and generating card advantage through cards like Liliana of the Veil and Sensei's Divining Top. Additionally, the deck has a versatile mana base with access to multiple colors to support its powerful spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill it with dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Grave-Troll. By discarding cards with abilities like Faithless Looting and Careful Study, the player can trigger powerful graveyard synergies and quickly amass a large board presence. Cards like Bridge from Below and Dread Return enable explosive plays, while Cabal Therapy disrupts the opponent's strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with an onslaught of creatures and combo abilities, utilizing dredge mechanics to its advantage in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence by playing efficient creatures like True-Name Nemesis, Silvergill Adept, and Lord of Atlantis. Use Aether Vial to cheat out creatures and disrupt opponent's spells with Force of Will. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of merfolk lords and evasive threats like Sower of Temptation. Utilize tribal synergy from cards like Merrow Reejerey to buff the team and close out the game with unblockable damage from Mutavault and Mishra's Factory.

The main concept of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly deploy a strong board presence using tribal synergy and disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures such as True-Name Nemesis, Lord of Atlantis, and Master of the Pearl Trident. By utilizing the tribal synergy and efficient creatures, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and win through aggressive attacks.

The main theme of this deck revolves around the aggressive use of Merfolk creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing powerful lords like Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis, this deck aims to boost its Merfolk creatures and deal damage quickly. Cards like Aether Vial and Mutavault help to provide additional creature presence and strategic advantage. With disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze, this Merfolk aggro deck seeks to establish early board control and pressure the opponent to secure victory.

The core idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost and Glimmerpost while disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Lodestone Golem. With powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Karn Liberated, the deck aims to apply pressure and control the board early on. Cards like All Is Dust and Steel Hellkite provide board wipe options, further solidifying the deck's aggressive and disruptive strategy. Overall, this MUD aggro deck focuses on overwhelming opponents with efficient mana usage and strong threats to gain victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis, along with powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. The deck aims to control the board with countermagic and removal spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, while pressuring the opponent with early threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency and contains disruptive lands like Wasteland. Overall, the deck seeks to win through quick aggression and overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Careful Study, then reanimating them onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Exhume. The key strategy is to cheat out massive threats like Griselbrand, Iona, and Inkwell Leviathan early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with their sheer power. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces and control the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through explosive plays and efficient reanimation.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur, and Griselbrand onto the battlefield by utilizing cards like Exhume, Goryo's Vengeance, and Shallow Grave. The deck also includes various spells to help dig for these creatures, protect them, and disrupt the opponent's game plan if necessary. The land base is designed to support the deck's mana requirements and ensure consistent casting of its key combo pieces.

This deck focuses on using control spells such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also utilizing powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Stoneforge Mystic to take over the game. The deck also includes efficient card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix to out-value the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruptive spells and powerful creatures, ultimately leading to victory through attrition and incremental card advantage.

This Legacy control Stoneblade deck focuses on utilizing powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull with Stoneforge Mystic, while also controlling the game through cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and True-Name Nemesis. It includes various ways to interact with opposing threats such as Supreme Verdict and Engineered Explosives, as well as strong planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while creating advantages through card advantage and powerful equipment.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana and draw cards to assemble the necessary pieces for the Storm combo, allowing the player to cast a high number of spells in a single turn and finish off the opponent with a massive Tendrils of Agony. The deck is focused on velocity and efficiency in order to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond. The high number of cantrips and mana rituals help to dig through the deck and generate the necessary resources to execute the combo.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Counterbalance, while also ensuring card advantage and card selection through cards like Supreme Verdict and Sensei's Divining Top. The deck also aims to effectively control the board with sweepers like Terminus and Supreme Verdict, while also having access to additional threats and disruption through cards like Vendilion Clique and Spell Pierce.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counter spells, removal, and card advantage to slow down the opponent and eventually overwhelm them with powerful angels summoned by Entreat the Angels. The deck aims to control the game through cards like Force of Will, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Counterbalance, while also maintaining card advantage with Sensei's Divining Top and Brainstorm. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, protect your own threats, and eventually win the game with a large swarm of angels.
